item.description:
Welcome to the Monday Happy Hours series!

This event is open to all, especially those who hate Mondays and especially for those who want to check out the different bar scenes in New Haven.

 

07/1/2011 location - Bar 63

I am really impressed by this place.  It's open, clean and all American. Comfortable while being classy, and gourmet without being pretentious. The bar features several drafts and a couple dozen or so bottles, all with a tasteful selection and variety. There are also delicious looking cocktails and wine. The menu seems to have heavy New York and New Orleans influences.  I've only had one thing (so far...) - the shrimp and grits.  And they were AMAZING.  And I'm not even a fan of grits normally.  The shrimp absolutely melted in my mouth; I just had it last night and I can't wait to go back for more.

If you wish, you may look at their website... (linked).

 

The event coordinator, Bethany, has been kind enough to say that she will put out a small sampling of their food.  Come out and who your support for this new business! (...and have a bite to eat)

Their usual great happy hour specials:

6-7pm:

$4: Well drinks, Frozen drinks and select drafts

$5: Wings, Nachos, Cheese Fries, Eggplant Stix and Mini Chili Dogs

 

Second shift happy hour - (if we last!) 10-11:30pm:

$2 Cans of beer from 'Grampa's Wine List'

$4 Frozen Drinks

$6: Chili Cheese Fries with Scrambled Eggs, Scrapple Grits and Eggs, Cheesy Skillet Hash and Fried Eggs, and Trash Omelet

 

Your contact/host is Devorah, call or texting is fine (# in RSVP). 

 

Please RSVP for this event to give them an accurate heads up.

For Happy Hour Events if you're only a Maybe please put this in your comment.

 

Come early, come late, leave early, stay late, everyone is always welcome...

Nothing ever cancels Monday Happy Hours. Ever.

***Bring a friend***
item.how_to_find_us: We will be in the upstairs bar area, at least to start. We may migrate (as a group or separately) to the patio depending on the weather. Feel free to ask a hostess or bartender where we are, or to call the event host's cell (in RSVP)
item.name: Happy Hour - *New Restaurant* Box 63
